cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax
cards.name: Angelic Protector
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Anoint
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they're done trying to kill us, all right?"
cards.name: Armor Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."

cards.flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter
cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Avenging Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.
cards.name: Bandage
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.
cards.name: Cataclysm
cards.text: Each player chooses from among the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."
cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.
cards.name: Conviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."
cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.
cards.name: Exalted Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.name: Field of Souls
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.
cards.name: Gallantry
cards.text:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"
cards.name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
cards.text: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Humility
cards.text: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.

cards.flavor: The true treasure no thief can touch.
cards.name: Kor Chant
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.

cards.flavor:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Master Decoy
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Mounted Archers
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn.

cards.flavor: The kor forsake roots for the winding of the path, forsake voices for the silence of the mind, forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.
cards.name: Nomads en-Kor
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

cards.flavor:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.name: Orim, Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the Predator.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
cards.name: Paladin en-Vec
cards.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

cards.name: Pegasus Stampede
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"The cannon wasn't aimed at you!" pleaded Vhati.
"I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."
cards.name: Repentance
cards.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

cards.flavor: Shackles of gold are still shackles.
cards.name: Shackles
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Shaman en-Kor
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Shaman en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that damage is dealt to Shaman en-Kor instead.

cards.flavor:
"You've got your childhood wish at last. Now you get to die."
—Gerrard, to Volrath
cards.name: Smite
cards.text: Destroy target blocked creature.

cards.name: Soltari Champion
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Champion attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Soltari Lancer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Soltari Lancer has first strike as long as it's attacking.

cards.flavor:
"Prayer rarely explains."
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.name: Soltari Monk
cards.text:
Protection from black
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

cards.text:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavor:
"Dauthi blood is soltari wine."
—Soltari Tales of Life
cards.name: Soltari Trooper
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
Death free throat from thirst, mouth from speech, feet from earth.
—Kor requiem
cards.name: Spirit en-Kor
cards.text:
Flying
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Spirit en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

cards.name: Spirit Mirror
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens on the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Reflection creature token onto the battlefield.
{0}: Destroy target Reflection.

cards.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.
cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Staunch Defenders
cards.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying
cards.name: Wall of Essence
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive kor people.
cards.name: Warrior en-Kor
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Warrior en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

cards.flavor:
"There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Winds of Rath
cards.text: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Capsize
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
cards.name: Curiosity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Dismiss
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Within without.
cards.name: Dream Halls
cards.text: Rather than pay the mana cost for a spell, its controller may discard a card that shares a color with that spell.

cards.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath
cards.name: Dream Prowler
cards.text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.

cards.flavor: From nothing came teeth.
cards.name: Ephemeron
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.

cards.text:
Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)

cards.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Gaseous Form

Enchant creature

cards.flavor: Cross the eyes of a hammerhead and you'll dot its teeth.

cards.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

Intuition

cards.flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
cards.name: Killer Whale
cards.text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Legacy's Allure
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. "Glok," he mumbled, and hid.
cards.name: Legerdemain
cards.text: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath
cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.
cards.name: Mawcor
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

cards.text: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.

cards.flavor: In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.
cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."

cards.flavor:
"Bitter water, vicious wave;
Shadow-cold shallows, root-made maze.
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

cards.text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Scrivener

cards.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

cards.text:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavor:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem

cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.

cards.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.
cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

cards.flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

cards.text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavor:
"You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."
—Lyna, to Ertai
cards.name: Thalakos Seer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
When Thalakos Seer leaves the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

cards.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

cards.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

Flying

cards.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.
cards.name: Twitch
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"No home, no heart, no hope."
—Stronghold graffito
cards.name: Wayward Soul
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax

Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."
—Volrath
cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."
cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Winged Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have flying.

cards.flavor: "Mine."
cards.name: Cannibalize

cards.flavor: Eating is all it knows.

cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.name: Clot Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."

cards.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath

cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

cards.flavor: "Rage is the only freedom left to me."
cards.name: Commander Greven il-Vec

Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.

Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Crovax the Cursed
cards.text:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .
cards.name: Cursed Flesh
cards.text:
Enchant creature

cards.flavor:
"It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."
—Volrath

Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

—Soltari Tales of Life

cards.flavor:

—Lyna, soltari emissary

Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"
cards.name: Death Pits of Rath
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.
cards.name: Death Stroke
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.
cards.name: Death's Duet
cards.text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

cards.flavor: A sickness stirs in its eyes, a nightmare born in darkened wails.

cards.text:
Flying

Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.
cards.name: Fugue
cards.text: Target player discards three cards.

cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

—Starke

cards.name: Anarchist
cards.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.
cards.name: Barbed Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.flavor: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.
cards.name: Canyon Wildcat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor:
What is high as a mountain and low as a snake?
—Dal riddle
cards.name: Craven Giant
cards.text: Craven Giant can't block.

cards.flavor:
"Carrion! Keep your distance. My blade will come to you!"
—Crovax
cards.name: Deadshot
cards.text: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.

cards.name: Fanning the Flames
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Fanning the Flames deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Flame Wave
cards.text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Flowstone Blade
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Once these horrifying creatures were perfected, there was no need for armodons.
cards.name: Flowstone Mauler
cards.text:
Trample
{R}: Flowstone Mauler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Flowstone Wyvern
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.
cards.name: Furnace Brood
cards.text: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
cards.name: Goblin Bombardment
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.
cards.name: Kindle
cards.text: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.

cards.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."
cards.name: Lowland Giant

cards.flavor: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.
cards.name: Mage il-Vec
cards.text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Magmasaur
cards.text:
Magmasaur enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur. If you don't, sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.flavor: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
cards.name: Maniacal Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

cards.flavor:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator
cards.name: Mogg Conscripts
cards.text: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.

cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"
cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.
cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Mogg Infestation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target player controls. For each creature that died this way, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield under that player's control.

cards.flavor: Stand clear if he gets an itch.
cards.name: Mogg Maniac
cards.text: Whenever Mogg Maniac is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent.

cards.flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.
cards.name: Ogre Shaman
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.name: Pandemonium
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.

cards.flavor:
Wrap the flame as twine,
Kingdoms will be thine.
cards.name: Rathi Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.

cards.flavor:
"His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."
—Volrath
cards.name: Renegade Warlord
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."
cards.name: Rolling Thunder
cards.text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.
cards.name: Sabertooth Wyvern
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.flavor:
"I used to describe something stable as ‘rock solid.' So much for that expression."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Sandstone Warrior
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Searing Touch
cards.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Searing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Seething Anger
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, soltari emissary
cards.name: Shadowstorm
cards.text: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.

cards.name: Shard Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor:
"Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys!"
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.
cards.name: Spellshock
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Spitting Hydra
cards.text:
Spitting Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spitting Hydra: Spitting Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke
cards.name: Starke of Rath
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Stun
cards.text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, soltari emissary
cards.name: Wall of Diffusion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.

cards.flavor:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."
cards.name: Aluren
cards.text: Any player may play creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less without paying their mana cost and as though they had flash.

cards.flavor:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: The hunter would never forget the time or place where he first met the carnassid, for they buried him there.
cards.name: Carnassid
cards.text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Regenerate Carnassid.

cards.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
cards.name: Crashing Boars
cards.text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

cards.flavor: As the bough stretches, so shall you grow. As the roots spread, so shall you thrive.
cards.name: Elven Rite
cards.text: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.

cards.name: Elvish Fury
cards.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: These are its last days. It is doomed to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.
cards.name: Endangered Armodon
cards.text: When you control a creature with toughness 2 or less, sacrifice Endangered Armodon.

cards.flavor: Changing Rath's landscape is like tearing the scab from a wound.
cards.name: Harrow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.
cards.name: Heartwood Dryad
cards.text: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.

cards.flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.
cards.name: Heartwood Giant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.
cards.name: Hermit Druid
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.
cards.name: Horned Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have trample.

cards.flavor:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Krakilin
cards.text:
Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.

cards.flavor: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
cards.name: Lowland Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Manabond
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary
cards.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
cards.text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.
cards.name: Mulch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
cards.name: Muscle Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.
cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Oath of Druids
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more creatures than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may reveal cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. If he or she does, that player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.
cards.name: Provoke
cards.text:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"See how you like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Reality Anchor
cards.text:
Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Recycle
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.

cards.flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.
cards.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
cards.name: Rootwalla
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor:
"It is our duty to endure."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.name: Skyshroud Elf
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.
cards.name: Skyshroud Troll
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.

cards.name: Spike Breeder
cards.text:
Spike Breeder enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a 1/1 green Spike creature token onto the battlefield.

{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Regenerate Spike Hatcher.

cards.flavor:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, ‘Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm
cards.name: Spined Wurm
Survival of the Fittest
cards.text: {G}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.
cards.name: Trained Armodon

cards.flavor:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.flavor:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.
cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.name: Verdigris
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.
cards.name: Wall of Blossoms
cards.text:
Defender

cards.flavor: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.
cards.name: Acidic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to target creature or player."

cards.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.
cards.name: Crystalline Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Dracoplasm
cards.text:
Flying
As Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.
{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.
cards.name: Hibernation Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."

cards.flavor: "I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."
cards.name: Selenia, Dark Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Pay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Her children are ever part of her.
cards.name: Sliver Queen
cards.text: {2}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Soltari Guerrillas
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.

cards.name: Spined Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.flavor:
"Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.
"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."
cards.name: Vhati il-Dal
cards.text: {T}: Until end of turn, target creature has base power 1 or base toughness 1.

cards.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."
cards.name: Victual Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."

cards.name: Wood Sage
cards.text: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.
cards.name: Coiled Tinviper
cards.text: First strike

cards.name: Cursed Scroll
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.
cards.name: Emmessi Tome
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"
cards.name: Erratic Portal
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.flavor:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax
cards.name: Grindstone
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.

cards.flavor: "Here."
cards.name: Jinxed Idol
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.

cards.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."
cards.name: Lotus Petal
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

cards.flavor:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."

"It'll get us to the portal, but I can't guarantee what it'll do to the ship."
